reviews.text: We stayed for two nights Sat/Sun. It's Travelodge, right? So you know what you get and that it is basic. On this basis I thought it was very good. The staff were warm, welcoming, friendly and helpful. The hotel's location is excellent, right in the middle of the city. We had a room on an upper floor. It was fine and quite roomy. Every thing in the room worked well. There was a little noise from other guests late at night but not too bad for a city centre travelodge. For the price I paid I thought it was excellent and I would definitely recommend it as a budget option.
reviews.title: Well located, good travelodge

reviews.text: It was a gud location for the MEN Arena to see Peter Kay but thats as far as it goes for good points. We were on the ground floor, the room had a bad smell of 'cats pee' . The room was grubby. The staff at front desk not helpful. our flights were cancelled due to the Ash and we asked the desk staff to book us rooms in Travelodge in Holyhead as we needed to ger ferry home, they didnyt help us. I wouldnt recommend it to anyone
reviews.title: Good Location but grubby hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice entrance, staff seemed friendly enough and we were checked in quickly! our room was not good at all!! very dated, stains on the walls and the bath was filthy didnt even want to stand in it to shower! no air con in the rooms and it was very hot! windows only opened a certain amount so not much of a breeze was able to reach the room!
reviews.title: Good location for MEN but wouldnt stay otherwise

reviews.text: there was no phone in the room to ring reception which was very inconveinient since we were only given one pillow and one towel for two people!
reviews.title: Great location for the MEN Arena

reviews.text: when we got into bed we could feel something under the sheet, once we took of the sheet we discovered it was a dental floss 'device' very large and not something a cleaner should have missed!! the matress was also full of very dark stains...
reviews.title: the location is excellent but the staff...
Don't bother - terrible standards
reviews.text: We booked a room at the Travelodge for an overnight stay following a concert trip on 13 November 2007. As we'd stayed here twice before in the past and had great service and accommodation we thought it'd be a safe bet again - how wrong we were!!!

reviews.title: Okay for the price!
reviews.text: The first room we were given had a broken bed - one of the legs fell off as my husband sat on it! After the initial giggles, we asked for another room, thinking that the problem was just a one off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in June and my daughter and her partner stayed too we were in Manchester for the Stevie Wonder concert. The hotel smells of mould in the rooms and corridors, the carpets are filthy and the shower and shower curtain had black mould growing on them! It was a very hot day and there was no air conditioning and when we asked for a fan they said they do not give them out to customers although there was one on the reception desk keeping the staff cool. After 4 months of complaining I have just recieved a full refund but even if I was offered a stay for free I would refuse.
reviews.title: Disgusting horrible hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has been clean and good value on every visit. The car park is very small but there's a large multi-storey next door. The hotel is in a great location, just off Deansgate, close to the MEN Arena & the Arndale shopping centre.
reviews.title: Clean, basic hotel - great location !

reviews.text: Avoid at all costs. Filthy rooms, unhelpful staff. Serious do not stop here. I reported condom to reception as we went out, it was still there when we got back several hours later. It may be cheap and some may say you get what you pay for and normally I would agree, but it's still no excuse for filthy conditions.
reviews.title: Used condom in bathroom - need I say more?

reviews.text: I normally stay at Travelodge as it is cheap and essentially a place to sleep. This has to be the worst place I have ever stayed in. The place is very shabby and needs drastic updating. There was work taking place, if this was the start of a refurb I am not sure but you can see this has been forgotten as it will always make money due to its central location. The corridors were dirty and smelled, my room also had a distinctive odour. The mould was apparent everywhere in the bathroom and the mattress was well past its use by date, hence a restless nights sleep. This hotel has really dented my faith in Travelodge and will always check how old the hotel is before considering it again. I cannot stress how much you should avoid this hotel. I stayed for business and there were 10+ others in the hotel and we were all of the same opinion.
reviews.title: Cheap but not even worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You know what you're getting with Travelodge - a basic stay with decent sized, clean rooms in decent locations. This one is no different. My only negative comments are that this place could do with a refurb - and soon! We'd prepayed for the all you can eat breakfast but once they'd run out of stuff, it wasn't replaced - not quite all you can eat, then! But the staff were lovely and the bed was very comfy. So I would stay there again if I needed to.l
reviews.title: What you see is what you get

reviews.text: Stayed here April 2nd for a kylie concert.
reviews.title: Stay at the premier inn instead for a spotless no frills hotel stay

reviews.text: Great location, less than 5 mins to Harvey nics and approx 15 to MEN. Positives end there Im afraid, lousy, slow service from staff and filthy rooms including hair stuck to bathroom wall and shower curtain, wee stained loo seat, creaky soft beds, spiders, stale smells and stained ceiling! My advice, book well ahead and you should get a premier inn for the same price, they are immaculate.
reviews.title: Unhelpful surly staff

reviews.text: Business trip -No staff on reception when I arrived to check in, auto check in machines both out of order. After 10 mins of loitering about I had to go to the bar to ask the bar staff to send someone over to let me check in, The staff member that eventually appeared was surly and abrupt. I suggested they had a bell on the desk as I'd been waiting 10 mins, she just shrugged and glared. The sheets were about the only clean thing in the room. There was a strange smell in the room which I didn't want to spend too much time thinking about what it might be. There was only one small bedside light that worked in the bedroom and the bathroom light. I put the kettle on before I went in the shower so that it would be ready when i came out, it was still boiling when i got out of the shower and had a room full of steam!!!. There was no remote for the television and I was told by reception that they had run out of remotes (same member of staff, completely indifferent)!! Given that I was a solo female business traveller I had no intention of leaving the hotel to go out, and I was unable to read by the very poor small light. I gave up and went to bed at 9.15pm
reviews.title: What a relief!

reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was dreading this stay (for a concert at MEN Arena) but I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. Helpful staff, good breakfast, great location (and we got a space in their car park). Of course it was basic and a bit tired, and our stay was midweek so we didn't have noise problems during the night. I gave a low mark for cleanliness, but to be honest it's more about the rooms needing renovated, rather than the day to day cleaning. But for the price we paid we have no complaints. If you don;t know Manchester, it's as near as you can get to the Arena, lots of shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: DUMP

reviews.text: Travel section at work booked us in here for two nights 9th/10th March.
reviews.title: Excellent value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By far the worse place that I've ever stayed. At £50 per night, I wouldn't call it cheap. There were multiple stains on the walls as though someone had thrown a cup of coffee on the walls, the sofabed had so many stains on it that we refused to touch it, the bathroom was old and mould was growing on the extractor fan that didn't work. The lifts didn't work for the entire weekend and the reception chairs that were supposed to be red were in fact black with dirt.
reviews.title: Worst place I've ever stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed a taxi but there wasn't a member of staff in sight so we had to lean over the counter to see the number and book our own taxi.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.text: I left feeling like I needed a shower and worry what illnesses people may catch from staying there. Never again.
reviews.title: The most terrible hotel I have ever seen

reviews.text: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for august bank holiday as we were staying for the manchester gay pride we styed for 3 nights. We arrived on the fri and check in was quick we arrived at our room which was on the 1st floor which was lucky as the lifts had broken and stayed that way for the whole of our stay!!! the rooms were pretty clean apart from a few stains on the carpet. when we checked in i had booked under 2 names mine and my partners 1 night under 1 name and 2 nights under the other name and i explained this when i checked in and this was no problem they even took £45 off me for 3 days breakfast but when we had returned from a day out on the sat we could not get in our room as they had messed up our reservation and said we should of checked out at 12 so why did they take £45 off me for breakfast!!!! it got sorted out in the end but the staff are sooooo!!! disorganised. They have a bar in the hotel which is hardly ever open we wanted to use it a couple of times but were told due to lack of staff they couldnt open it they must be lossing loads of money. Also dont think the breakfast is worth the money there is alot of choice but the cooked breakfast is cold and the bread is left out so long the sides curl up its just not worth it. I dont think we will be stopping at this hotel again we paid £60 a night for the both of us this wasnt including breakfast the only good thing was that it was only a 2 min walk to the main shopping area.
reviews.title: Convenient, but basic. Look for deals.

reviews.text: We booked to stay in Travelodge Manchester Central for 1 night only on our way to Scotland. Few hours after we checked in, we left the hotel. The rooms were dirty and smely with stains and mould.
reviews.title: Great central place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped here Friday night to watch Peter Kay and paid £22 for the room. Room clean, bed comfortable, plenty of towels, bathroom a bit grubby. Paid £7.50 to park for 24 hours. Excellent locatiion for MEN and bars & restaurants. Would stop here again but dont think I would pay full price.
reviews.title: GOT WHAT WE PAID FOR

reviews.text: stayed here while we went to the manchestar arena its only a couple of minutes walk away so that was great.thats where the good things end.we managed to squeeze into the car park thats like a jigsaw not a lot of room.when we returned from the concert we was all ready for a good night sleep but there was no chance of that here the road next to the hotel is non stop all night just when you think it can't get any worse the bin wagon comes along so it must be narely morning and you still haven't been to sleep.the breakfast all you can eat for 7 pounds fifty thats aslong as no one else wants any food.we qued up for a good 20 minutes and all that came out was about 6 sausages and a bit of bacon.i think there was trying to cook it on a george forman grill for the all hotel got our cash back like a lot more people.we endded up at britsh home stores for our breakfast for 99 pence so thats where to go for your braekfast don't even bother trying to eat here
reviews.title: graet location but thtas it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I honestly cannot understand what everyone is moaning about. Yes, the rooms are basic, yes they probably need a lick of paint but that is what travelodge is all about. Cheap and cheerful! Where else can you stay which is a 5 min walk from Manchester MEN, a two course evening meal for £6 each and all you can eat brekkie for £7.50???
reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable - brilliant location for MEN

reviews.text: We had an excellent stay on the third floor, there was some hen and stag parties in which could explain the problems with the hgher floors but we would definitely stay again!! Peter Kay was great too.
reviews.title: If paid more than £19 would not be happy

reviews.text: We booked this months in advance with the £19 room saver deal
reviews.title: Smelly, Mouldy & Dirty Rooms

reviews.text: Hotel staff with the IQ of Gravel. Filthy rooms. Shabby and tired furniture and decorations. Didn't expect the Ritz but did expect clean. Wont bother with Travelodge again. Customer service team don't seem to give a dam.
reviews.title: Dirty Shabby Dump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last night myself and my partner spent the night at this hotel. The first thing I noticed when I went into the room were large gouges in the wall and ceiling and there were stains all over the wallthat was for starters and summed up the rest of the evening. My partner then went into the shower and couldn't turn it on and then later turn it off as the tap kept coming off in her hand. While having her shower the bath was filling up, the cause was the plug hole was full of hairs, and by their appearance they had been there for a while. Trying to open the windows it was stifling hot only to find that on one window the latch was missing and the final straw when we went out for the evening both lifts had broken down and myself being disabled and only able to fully use one leg, going down even a few steps is difficult never mind many flights. So next time i'll spend that little bit extra and stick with Premier Inn.
reviews.title: Not quite to Premier Inn's Standard

reviews.text: This hotel is cheap and central but that is where the good stuff ends!
reviews.title: Grubby, dirty, unhygienic, hope I didn't catch anything!!

reviews.text: When we went to check in we discovered that the hotel no longer offered a left luggage service, something not told to us when we booked, so we had to drag our luggage around town for 4 hours.
reviews.title: We had so many things to complain about!

reviews.text: Our room was disgustingly grubby, hair left on the shower wall and the toilet seat was stained with urine. The bed was extremely uncomfortable due to the thin mattress and squeeked and jungled everytime you rolled over. The carpet had a large iron stain on it as well as some other suspect markings - I didn't dare walk around without shoes on and went in the shower wearing flip flops.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel
its cheap for a reason!
reviews.text: Well you cant find a much cheaper hotel unless you're prepared to check into a hostal! But its true, you get what you pay for. Some travelodges are quite bright and cheerful with good quality newly refurbished rooms. This travelodge however is quite depressing! I arrived at 10am so needed to store my luggage. they said due to security they coudnt do this. apprently this is procedure in all travelodge's! So i was left waiting along with other customers in the lobby for a couple of hours until the rooms were available. Try you're hardest not to get a room on a high floor. when i was there only one of the 2 lifts were working, which meant a looooooooooong wait for a lift, so i just took the stairs most days! The room was preety dirty to say the least, although the linen and towels appeared clean. the tv reception was a bit dodgy. depending on where you stay in the hotel, will depend on the quality of some channels. The parking was a nightmare unless you have a small car, but is very cheap.

reviews.title: Good Value Clean Hotel
reviews.text: So all in all, unless you can get a cheap room (19 or 26 quid a night) i really woudnt bother. Pay slightly more and you'll get a much better experience. And whatever you do, DO NOT take you're partner here!!!! They will not appreciate it!

reviews.title: Great Value, and cosy.
reviews.text: We Stayed in this Travel Lodge as other guests had, to go to the Take That Concert and found the hotel to be very good value very central and our family room was huge, it included tea and coffee a kettle ,colour TV,our room had a view over the canal we stayed for 2 nights and the room was very quiet at night.

reviews.title: No complaints
reviews.text: As there was 3 of us in this family room it worked out at about £23.00 each a night, i think this is fantastic value for a city hotel and would stay again.

reviews.title: Why will they not store luggage and why are the staff so rude?
reviews.text: My husband and i went to this travelodge basically because it was very close to the MEN arena to see take that. It was 5 mins walk. The rooms which are pictured on trip advisor as correct. They do however have tea making facilities and coffee. We were charged £61.00 for the night and was well worth it. The beds were so comfy, i didnt want to get out. We were told some of the cast of Coronation Street went there, so we knew it would be ok. Staff on reception were curtious, and the breakfast was all you could eat for £7 pp, very nice too. Breakfast consists of usual juices, all varieties of tea, scrambled egg, sausage, mushrooms, toms, bread, and cereal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ours was a one night stopover after a great night at the UCI track cycling at the National Cycling center in Manchester.
reviews.title: A tired looking hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We arrived at 2.30 p.m. to be told to come back after 3.00 p.m. unless we were prepared to pay a premium. Our confirmation online booking form said check in after 2.00 p.m. When we returned our first room had a bed with one leg missing, plaster falling off one wall and looked very tired. When we complained we were immediately handed the key for another room opposite This room had a sofa bed and a plastic chair so was an improvement but the bath and bath wall was dirty so were a couple of the bedroom walls and one of the two curtains was partly hanging off the rail.
reviews.title: cheap and cheerful

reviews.text: Returning back from the cycling before midnight all was quiet for a while until doors started banging, loud music played and corridors became a means to loudly get from one room to another. This group of party revellers decided to party through until 4 a.m. without thought for other guests and were not for stopping!
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We were first at breakfast which was good and staff were very curteous. Our plan was to have a good look at Manchester but we drove back to Cambridge - tired.
reviews.title: Dirty but central Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all car parking cost £11.50, £7.50 for an overnight stay and £4 to park before the overnight stay time cut in. The car park is very tight - is under the hotel so parking spaces are between the concrete support pillars - fine for 1960's size cars.
reviews.title: It was what i expected for the price

reviews.text: Brilliant location for city centre, Arndale Centre and MEN arena. There was 3 of us so we had a family room with a double bed and pullout bed. Room was large enough for us not to feel cramped in. Bathroom needed a major revamp and the bedroom could have done with a makeover too but it was adequate for 1 night. Parking at the Travelodge is charged at £7.50 overnight but there are plenty of car parks just around the corner for half the price (we parked in Green Gate).
reviews.title: brill location but needs a makeover

reviews.text: So in general, the great thing about this hotel is the fact that the room is incredibly gigantic. The fact that if you did a log roll on the floor in a family room, gives you at least 8 rolls, shows the size of it. However, I think the cleaning staff need to learn how to make beds, as you encounter a huge bulge in the bed. Also, they need to repaint the rooms as you can see a lot of cracks and dampness and they need to fix the showers. The staff however were fine, with their helpfulness and quick service. Best thing in the whole room was by far, the aerobic mat given to you as a bed however, was never used as a one within our stay. I wouldn't recommend it as a long stay but for a night it is pretty alright.
reviews.title: Umm...HUGE ROOM

reviews.text: I have used Travelodges many time and so was not expecting the earth but this is awful in every respect. Grim, 60‘s office block in need of demolition given last lease of life as a Deansgate hinterland doss-house for the easy-to-please on a budget. One lift out of two out of order; room smelled of fag-smoke; no chair in the room. I asked for one to be put in; was told I would have to carry one up from the bar indicating virtually no people are employed here to serve the guests.... Oh yes, the bar.....no draft lager available and barmaids caused a near explosion with the CO2 canister trying to attach a new barrel indicating zero staff training. Tinny, mildly distorted 80’s dross music playing at an intrusive volume so I declined the “two bottles of Wifebeater for £5” offer and went for a proper pint elsewhere. Had dinner out. Returned to try and answer emails only to find the Travelodge’s WiFi provider seems to have perfected almost Dickensian trick of preventing iPhone 3G access from the room thus forcing you to pay their onerous fees. Went out again rather than pay, returned to sleep only to endure sadistically uncomfortable bed made worse by the constant thrumming of various pieces of heavy machinery nearby that seemed to be in constant use. After all this, I did not dare risk breakfast so went to Pret instead and fell in with the door at 7 AM. Returned once more to try an revive myself under a useless, dribbling shower. Single bar of cheap soap in the bathroom was the only concession to personal hygiene. I only booked as I had a £15 voucher which brought the cost of this miserable stay down to £30. Proof again that you get exactly what you pay for. Bring your wife here if you are looking for a cheap divorce; I’m sure she will just leg it vowing never to take a penny on the condition you agree to a restraining order never to come within 10 miles of her ever again. This hotel is a disgrace.
reviews.title: Grim, Deansgate hinterland doss-house for the easy-to-please on a budget

reviews.text: Spent one night here and thank goodness it was only one night. Room was massive. Bathroom was adequate however no hot water so couldnt have a shower, had to make do with sink. Had a foisty smell in room. Main double bed was disgusting - had to sleep on top of bed as sheets had holes in and were stained and I was not getting in there! Woke up next day to find I had been bit on my face once and that was just from pillow as never entered sheets. Pull out bed adequate however one sheet and one duvet when two kids taken so had to trail down from 7th floor to ask for extra bedding. Only met one member of staff she was very helpful and friendly so can't blame staff. Put me off big time. Have stayed in Premier Inns before and Holiday Inns and they are far superior to this. Thank goodness I was only there 11 hours. Pay the extra and stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Avoid!!

reviews.text: Ok here it goes! Was so worried about what I had let myself into due to all the reviews. But actually wasnt that bad.
reviews.title: Not as bad as I expected!
